dataIdInfo.idAbs: Converts objects from a CAD file to a defined feature class type along with the point features that are near those CAD features. This tool has been deprecated. For more information, see An overview of the Samples toolbox.

tool.name: CADtoFeatureClass
tool.summary: Converts objects from a CAD file to a defined feature class type along with the point features that are near those CAD features. This tool has been deprecated. For more information, see An overview of the Samples toolbox.

pythonReference.para: The CAD file that will be converted to an ArcGIS feature class.

dialogReference.para: The CAD file that will be converted to an ArcGIS feature class.

pythonReference.para: The feature class that will be created from the input CAD file.

dialogReference.para: The feature class that will be created from the input CAD file.

pythonReference.para: The geometry type of the output feature class or shapefile.

dialogReference.para: The geometry type of the output feature class or shapefile.

pythonReference.para: The SQL query expression that will be used to select records.

dialogReference.para: The SQL query expression that will be used to select records.

pythonReference.para: The field info is used to review and alter the field names for the new layers fields. Fields can be hidden, and a split policy can be specified.

dialogReference.para: The field info is used to review and alter the field names for the new layers fields. Fields can be hidden, and a split policy can be specified.

bullet_item.para: If you change the visibility of a field from the Field control parameter to false, you will omit that field from the output feature class.
Complex feature classes, such as annotation and dimensions, are not supported by this tool.
If a SQL expression is used but returns nothing, the output feature layer will be empty.
